ListVar, Operation
public class Var<V>
extends Signal<V>

Var class. Describe a variable that changes in time.

caronyn

merge

public final <X,W> Var<X> merge(Var<W> merge,
                                Function2<X,V,W> mapfold)
Merge two signal together. If any signal emit, the resulting signal will emit. Consider this operation like an and boolean operation.

Type Parameters:
X - Type of the resulting var.
W - Type of the merged var.
Parameters:
merge - the var to merge with.
mapfold - the map fold transformation function.
It's goal is to merge the two values together and returned in the desired type.
Returns:
the new merged signal.

filterFold

public final Signal<V> filterFold(Predicate2<V,V> filter)
Filter the event according a criteria on the value and it's previous.
Finish signal is not filtered.

Parameters:
filter - predicate to filter. If result is true, event pass else it is blocked.
Returns:
the new filtered signal.

fold

public final Signal<V> fold(Function2<V,V,V> function)
Fold current value with previous one. Finish signal is transformed with the same functor.

Overrides:
fold in class Signal<V>
Parameters:
function - specify the action to perform between previous value and current.
Returns:
the new value.

sync

public final <X,W> Var<X> sync(Var<W> sync,
                               Function2<X,V,W> mapfold)
Synchronize signal together. The both signals should be emited before resulting signal will emit.
Consider this operation like an or boolean operation.

Type Parameters:
X - Type of the resulting var.
W - Type of the merged var.
Parameters:
sync - the var to merge with.
mapfold - the map fold transformation function.
It's goal is to merge the two values together and returned in the desired type.
Returns:
the new merged signal.
